title.english: The Demon Sword Master of Excalibur Academy

description:
One thousand years ago, Leonis Death Magnus, undead sorcerer and the greatest of the Dark Lords, entered magical stasis during a climactic battle. When he awakens, he finds a beautiful silver-haired young woman named Riselia standing before him. More shockingly, Leonis has been transformed into a ten-year-old boy! Now he'll have to adapt to this strange era and deal with the twisted monsters called Voids—all while keeping his true powers a secret from his lovely new guardian.

(Source: Yen Press)

Note: Each episode streamed 1 week early on ABEMA. The original TV broadcast started on October 3rd, 2023.
hashtag: #聖剣学院の魔剣使い #せまつか
synonyms: Demon's Sword Master of Excalibur School
จอมมารเกิดใหม่ วิทยาลัยผู้พิทักษ์
Lo spadaccino demoniaco all'accademia delle arti sacre

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Nudity

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/229166670/)

After graduating from the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering at Fukuoka University, he joined the animation studio [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). There his first work as an in-betweener was on [Hiatari Ryoukou!](https://anilist.co/anime/729/). Afterwards, he went freelance and worked on films such as [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/) and [Kiki's Delivery Service](https://anilist.co/anime/512/) before debuting as a key animator on [Lupin III: Bye Bye, Lady Liberty](https://anilist.co/anime/1415/) in 1989.

Him working on [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s films as an animator led to him being selected as a director for [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597/). A movie which remains as one of his most noted works today. In 2007, he directed his first TV series, [Bokurano](https://anilist.co/anime/1690/).

Yuji Nomi is a music composer/arranger, born in 1958 in Tokyo.   Started his music activities at several art gallery by making multiplex recorded music with a synthesizer for his friend's art performances. Coincidentally, those music were noticed by Ryuichi Sakamoto, then Nomi has released his LP, Oshare TV from MIDI record in 1986, under the supervision of Mr.Sakamoto. After then, joined making/arranging music for the films produced by Mr.Sakamoto such as Adventures of Milo and Otisi, Wings of Honneamise. Also joined as an orchestrator for The Last Emperor the film.   Having made film music for Whisper of The Heart (Mimi O Sumaseba) the film by Studio Ghibli in 1995, then he also made music for two short films by Miyao Hayazaki, Koro No Oosampo and Kujiratori, for the Ghibli Museum of Tokyo in 2001. And made Ghibli's film music again in Hiroyuki Morita's The Cat Returns (Neko No Ongaeshi).

__Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Blog](https://hh22.hatenablog.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dne_bu_hh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ひらさわひさよし)

Hisayoshi is a sound director and animation producer, and also the chairman of the animation studios [Creators in Pack](https://anilist.co/studio/6072) and [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/Passione).

__[Website](https://fujikawachiai.com/profile/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Nippon Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/artist-info/fujikawachiai/prof.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujikawachiai)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fujikawa_chiai/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPn4XA6Gb2u8y_FXXtrHW7w)__

__Height:__ 162 cm
__Graduated:__ Okayama Prefectural Kasaoka Commercial High School

__Introduction:__
Chiai Fujikawa is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Nippon Columbia (2018-). Before going solo she was a lead singer in the idol group Maneki Kecak, between July of 2015 until her departure from the group in September of 2018. She has additionally performed at the Nippon Budokan, which took place on September 24 of 2018.

Activities as a solo artist began after debuting at "TOKYO CULTURE CULTURE", where she held an Acoustic Live event on November 25 of 2018, this was followed-up with her first album release on May of 2019, titled "Raika".

__Biography:__
After graduating high school, Chiai aimed to become a singer while working at a factory. She mentions how she wanted to write her own lyrics whenever she became an artist, so she had been writing poems in her notebooks since she was a student. Whenever she came up with a word, sentence, or anything that could be used in a song, she would write it in a notepad she kept on her phone.
Ryoutarou Akao is the founder and representative director of Studio Gao.
_Note: Not to be confused with the veteran [Animator](https://anilist.co/staff/288485)._

title.native: 最強陰陽師の異世界転生記
